DataElement.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Old 13 Digit Disease or Disorder Extent Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Detailed site-specific codes for EOD used by SEER for selected sites of cancer for tumors diagnosed 1973-1982, except death-certificate-only cases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Stage Prognostic Factor Old 13 Digit Disease or Disorder Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Extent of Disease (EOD) used by SEER for selected sites of cancer for tumors diagnosed 1973-1982, except death-certificate-only cases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.:The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
The general personal and health characteristics that have a bearing on the course of a disease and its eventual outcome.

Property.preferredName: Old Integer::13 Digit Diseases and Disorders Extent
Property.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists:A number with no fractional part.::13:A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Not new, of an earlier time.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredName: Old Thirteen Digit Disease or Disorder Extent Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: No Value Exists_No Value Exists_A finger or toe in human beings or corresponding part in other vertebrates._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
